document.title: &dactyl.appName; Starting

description.p: Execute a single Ex command after all initialization has been performed. See initialization.
This option can be specified multiple times.
Execute a single Ex command before any initialization has been performed. See initialization.
This option can be specified multiple times.

The file rcfile is used for user initialization commands. If rcfile is "NORC" then no startup initialization is performed except for the loading of plugins, i.e., steps 1. and 2. in initialization are skipped. If rcfile is "NONE" then plugin loading is also skipped.
Prevents plugin scripts from being loaded at startup. See loadplugins.

document.p: At startup, &dactyl.appName; completes the following tasks in order.

li.p: &dactyl.appName; first searches for user initialization commands in the following locations. The first of these to be found is executed, after which no further locations are searched.

ol.li:
$&dactyl.idName;_INIT
May contain a single Ex command (e.g., ":source file").

~/_&dactyl.name;rc
Windows only. If this file exists, its contents are executed and $MY_&dactyl.idName;RC set to its path.

~/.&dactyl.name;rc
If this file exists, its contents are executed.

li.p: If exrc is set and the +u command-line option was not specified, then any RC file in the current directory is also sourced.

All directories in runtimepath are searched for a ‘plugins’ subdirectory and all yet unloaded plugins are loaded. For each plugins directory, all *.{js,&dactyl.fileExt;} files (including those in further subdirectories) are sourced alphabetically. No plugins will be sourced if,

ul.li: the ++noplugin command-line option was specified, or

li.p: Any plugin which was already loaded (e.g., by an earlier invocation of the :loadplugins command) will be skipped.

document.p: The user's home directory is determined as follows:

ul.li: On Unix and Mac, the environment variable $HOME is used.
On Windows, &dactyl.appName; checks for the existence of %HOME%, then %USERPROFILE%, and then %HOMEDRIVE%%HOMEPATH%. It uses the first one it finds.

description.p: Write current key mappings and changed options to file. If no file is specified then ~/.&dactyl.name;rc is written unless this file already exists. The special version :mk&dactyl.name;rc! will overwrite file if it exists.
description.warning: This behavior differs differs from that of Vim, which defaults to writing the file in the current directory.
